column1: Little Goat Diner////Redemption occurred in the form of two excellent dishes. The Okonomiyaki was solid: salty
column3: and sweet. The chives were a great touch as they brough some freshness to an otherwise intensely decadent dish. I think more bonito flakes would have dialed the flavor up even more. My Los Drowned sandwich
column4: a plump stack of juicy braised beef and fixings in crusty bolillo bread
column5: was excellent and insanely filling. Factoring in the acidity of the pickled onions
column7: and the fresh crunch of the cole slaw
column8: the dang thing was so flavorful that the accompanying jus became sort of an afterthought. Little Goat gets a solid B+/A- from me.
